commit_message:
Allow run_update_ansible_action run with Mistral or Ansible

We extend run_update_ansible_action
to allow running the Ansible playbooks with Mistral
or executing directly thru Ansible.

This is needed  in case we need to run
exceptionally a task depending on Mistral
but Mistral is broken. For example, retry
an upgrade operation after having Mistral broken.

Change-Id: I15511b4f36260292e0ea4100b15b8e65a701b38b
(cherry picked from commit 5249fbb2623165ef40098631fad18104579450c9)

commit_message:
Restart only installed services

Avoids deployment failure while doing the restart of services when
rsyslog was not installed.

Failure was found while attempting a standalone deployment on a
fresh RHEL8 host.

Change-Id: I286029011e36dd35411987c7918916f8082d885b

[{'created': '2019-07-10 16:43:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix copying apt keys from host to containers

Without the trailing slash the keys had an extra level of directories
as follows: /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/trusted.gpg.d/<keys>

Change-Id: Ibe4112ef947513439643025ddf0fd543b28aba70
(cherry picked from commit 9fd34ada152889c06c744ea5b4928c3554c9b4c5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix copying apt keys from host to containers

Without the trailing slash the keys had an extra level of directories
as follows: /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/trusted.gpg.d/<keys>

Change-Id: Ibe4112ef947513439643025ddf0fd543b28aba70
(cherry picked from commit 9fd34ada152889c06c744ea5b4928c3554c9b4c5)

commit_message:
Translatable output strings in heal allocation

This patch fixes the issue with output string composition in nova-manage
heal allocation that made translation of such string nearly impossible.

Change-Id: I0cb5424b0861536e6349c335fda301093d8651e8
Related-Bug: #1819923

[{'created': '2019-04-02 08:24:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for UWSGI as plain mod_wsgi is long deprecated

The origina spec which requested wsgi points out that uwsgi is the
primary choice and that mod_uwsgi is not free from defects:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/deploy-api-in-wsgi.html#completion-criteria

In fact, sahara-api does not currently work (start) when tls-proxy is used.
Instead of trying to fix a deprecated (never supported) configuration,
add support for uwsgi, which is the default choice.
This change should be backported, pending release team approval,
to all supported branches that deploy using mod_wsgi (rocky and stein.)

Change-Id: Idb504b9833f57b8b3ae5f731d27dbe79e3a4d069

commit_message:
Add support for UWSGI as plain mod_wsgi is long deprecated

The origina spec which requested wsgi points out that uwsgi is the
primary choice and that mod_uwsgi is not free from defects:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/deploy-api-in-wsgi.html#completion-criteria

Add support for uwsgi, which is now the default choice.

Change-Id: Idb504b9833f57b8b3ae5f731d27dbe79e3a4d069

commit_message:
Limit envlist to py37 for Python 3 Train goal

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train. The correct zuul jobs are
already in place so this change just limits default 'tox' calls to py37
to save developers time.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I1d2cbec2b2f15ca1c6942947f369cf7192993a2d
Story: #2005924
Task: #34244

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-20 05:55:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix the bug that trust scoped token can't create another token for sahara

When sahara uses trust scoped token to create another token,
keystone isn't allowed. To do so to invite elevation of privilege attacks.
So we need to identify the trust scoped token to prevent to create
another token.

The solution to the problem:
When the token is trust scoped token, we add auth_ref and prevent to
create another token.

Change-Id: Iea560e5d9984f4f2841d43a323a10d07646a71de

commit_message:
Fix the trust scoped token can't create another token.

When sahara uses trust scoped token to create another token,
keystone isn't allowed. To do so to invite elevation of privilege attacks.
So we need to identify the trust scoped token to prevent to create
another token.

The solution to the problem:
When the token is trust scoped token, we add auth_ref and prevent to
create another token.

Change-Id: Iea560e5d9984f4f2841d43a323a10d07646a71de
Related-Bug: #1717918

Summary:

Total: 304/320

Error classes:

7   nodepool.private_ipv4 not assigned
4   Rocky Mariadb deploy failure
2   opendev.org: Temporary failure in name resolution
1   SSH permission denied during initial-setup

I think we're good to release."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-17 09:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
DNM: Test MariaDB failures in CI

A few minimal relevant jobs are left to grind failures.
Using master CI config rather than stein to use fixed config.

Extra stuff:
Fix to glance-api (will be refactored later)
Fix to default docker_restart_policy (...)

Change-Id: I6e7f375cd80a2565316a971dc7defcd8e533de5c
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

Is this expected to remove py36? The only reference to Python 3.6 in the spec seems to hint that Python 3.6 can stay: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-07-08 15:55:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The idea is to only run the latest py3 when running default 'tox'. It will save time for developers and if they want to run py36 explicitly they can run 'tox -e py36'. It was discussed in #openstack-tc. This is flexible though on your end if you want to keep py36 and py37 in tox.ini."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-07-09 09:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Limit envlist to py37 for Python 3 Train goal

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train. The correct zuul jobs are
already in place so this change just limits default 'tox' calls to py37
to save developers time.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I98c5f62ea546d4b1a3094a6ce5ff387b08742b54

should allow devstack to find the process when tls-proxy is enabled

'}, {'created': '2019-04-04 15:31:26.000000000', 'message': 'WIP devstack: fixes (heathcheck UR, start_tls_proxy)

This change tries to fix few issues which prevents the usage
of tls-proxy.

- When checking whether sahara-api is up, use a proper (?) URI
  which works properly when *wsgi is used (the default since rocky.)
- Fix the call to start_tls_proxy, which has been broken
  for few years since https://review.openstack.org/364013
  (so probably forever.)

Change-Id: I548d989e98716c71ff28774ad11b182cd6f5b944
'}, {'created': '2019-04-05 09:49:33.000000000', 'message': 'WIP devstack fixes (heathcheck URL, start_tls_proxy, mod_wsgi)

This change tries to fix few issues which prevents the usage
of tls-proxy.

- When checking whether sahara-api is up, use a proper (?) URI
  which works properly when *wsgi is used (the default since rocky.)
- Fix the call to start_tls_proxy, which has been broken
  for few years since https://review.openstack.org/364013
  (so probably forever.)
- Fix the mod_wsgi configuration to use the internal port
  when tls-proxy is enabled, in order not to clash with
  the sahara/tls-proxy configuration.

Change-Id: I548d989e98716c71ff28774ad11b182cd6f5b944
'}]
commit_message:
WIP devstack fixes (heathcheck URL, start_tls_proxy, mod_wsgi)

This change tries to fix few issues which prevents the usage
of tls-proxy.

- When checking whether sahara-api is up, use a proper (?) URI
  which works properly when *wsgi is used (the default since rocky.)
- Fix the call to start_tls_proxy, which has been broken
  for few years since https://review.openstack.org/364013
  (so probably forever.)
- Fix the mod_wsgi configuration to use the internal port
  when tls-proxy is enabled, in order not to clash with
  the sahara/tls-proxy configuration.

Change-Id: I548d989e98716c71ff28774ad11b182cd6f5b944

commit_message:
Don't use special api-quick-start location

To simplify publishing of the guide, we don't use the special directory
anymore, remove it for translated documents as well.

Change-Id: I0520314f4946736b78e9d7438d676739c741f7b1

[{'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-11 01:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-12 02:00:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think we need to figure out what happens if the host doesn't support the requested spec, and how we could do this better with traits so we can do filtering in the scheduler."}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-12 09:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-04-16 09:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Can we abandon https://review.openstack.org/#/c/648619/ ?'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-04-16 09:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-18 03:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-18 03:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-04-18 05:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-04-18 06:22:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I have talk with WangYa. There is case we need to solve. There must a case the user doesn't want use 'auto_converge' and 'post_copy', so if we ask the user to write a forbidden trait for COMPUTE_AUTO_CONVERGE or COMPUTE_POST_COPY. That will force the request going to a host without the auto_converge and post_copy support. But actually, we required qemu > 2.5, that means all the hosts support those two features. That leads to no way to disable this two features for the instance.

I suggested to introduce two new extra specs 'auto_converge=true/false' and 'post_copy=true/false' instead of asking the user write the required/forbidden trait directly.

So before calling the placement, when the post_copy/auto_converge=true, we add required trait for this two features to the placement request. When the post_copy/auto_converge=false, we just add nothing to the placement request. Then we still can schedule an instance on a host with those two feature but we disable this two features for that instance."}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-18 13:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-18 14:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-04-19 06:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-19 06:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-19 07:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This seems straightforward to me."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-26 02:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(18 comments)

I've got several questions inline, mostly for trying to clarify the proposed change and scenarios. I'm potentially getting confused by the over-use of the term "operator" in here since operator to me is the admin of the cloud, not the end user. The operator provides the service, the user consumes it.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-26 02:30:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I think I'd also like Kashyap to take a look at this."}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-26 08:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-04-26 08:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(4 comments)

LGTM, but Matt and Kashyap may want to take a look at'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-05-05 03:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-05-05 03:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-05-20 12:29:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

LGTM except the prefix for the new extra specs, but I'm looking for other people give suggestion on that"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-20 19:06:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

Still good with this. A couple of (probably implementation) notes inline.

Procedurally, at least Matt and Sylvain should have another look at this before we approve it. And Kashyap, on Matt's recommendation."}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-05-21 08:22:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

(21 comments)

The idea to allow exposing auto-converge / post-copy on a per-instance basis is reasonable.

I have some nits on phrasing; not going to -1 them, as they can be addressed in a follow-up (or in this one, if there is a strong need to respin this.)'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-05-22 10:15:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Sorry, but I'm not OK with having image properties to be superseding the conf options, hence this -1."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-22 20:54:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-05-27 01:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-05-27 01:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> (1 comment)

Yes, we have policy control on update image properties API.

Reference:
  https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/admin/policies.html
  https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/?expanded=#update-image'}, {'account_id': 27614, 'date': '2019-05-31 03:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > Yes, we have policy control on update image properties API.
 > 
 > Reference:
 > https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/admin/policies.html
 > https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/?expanded=#update-image

By default, administrator and the image owner both have write access to image properties.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-05-31 11:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I don't like us exposing "post copy" this way.
In the past we said this was too hypervisor specific.

We came up with the term "force complete" instead:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/pike/approved/live-migration-force-after-timeout.html

I would much rather we use the "force complete" term here.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-05-31 11:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

I think we can do better than the options listed here, and abstract away form the implementation details.

In fact I think we should learn from the "maintenance-policy" that google's cloud offers.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-31 17:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-03 20:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

docutils 0.15 breaks the py2 tests, avoid the version for py2.

subject: fix deploy failed when ipv6 module does not load
messages:
[{'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2019-07-17 02:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2019-07-17 06:27:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-17 07:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

^ all ditto for nova

though more importantly: this may fail to find that ipv6 is available when it actually is not compiled as a module but built into the running kernel - better check availability of ipv6 sysctl options (aka "duck typing")

comment: in reality it is highly unlikely to find nowadays a system with no ipv6 support, IoT (so embedded) also seems to run it to benefit from the vast space of addresses'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2019-07-17 12:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2019-07-17 12:33:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > ^ all ditto for nova
 > 
 > though more importantly: this may fail to find that ipv6 is
 > available when it actually is not compiled as a module but built
 > into the running kernel - better check availability of ipv6 sysctl
 > options (aka "duck typing")
 > 
 > comment: in reality it is highly unlikely to find nowadays a system
 > with no ipv6 support, IoT (so embedded) also seems to run it to
 > benefit from the vast space of addresses
thanks for your review, the error is sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/net/ipv6/ip_nonlocal_bind: no such file or directory
my OS release is  CentOS Linux release 7.2.1511 (Core), this os does not load ipv6 module. and how to check sysctl options  to ensure whether failed?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-17 13:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

CentOS 7.2 has been obsoleted long time ago, the current release is 7.6

keeping my -1 because using lsmod is not very precise
I think we need a better solution for a more general case'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2019-07-23 13:34:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > CentOS 7.2 has been obsoleted long time ago, the current release is
 > 7.6
 > 
 > keeping my -1 because using lsmod is not very precise
 > I think we need a better solution for a more general case

ok， i have no idea for better solution.，and there's a lot need to fix too. i will abandon this ps later.thanks"}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2019-07-23 13:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
fix deploy failed when ipv6 module does not load

now, when we do not use ipv6, we also set ipv6 binding to sysctl.
we should check whether ipv6 module has load,and to decide whether
to set ipv6 binding to sysctl.

Change-Id: I941fb330f52c882a3d54f0a00f756463cce20df4

There's some rework still needed here wrt moving user-facing info into its own doc, but that's work for another patch"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-10 19:28:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> There's some rework still needed here wrt moving user-facing info into its own doc, but that's work for another patch

I'm not sure what is user-facing about this since by default this is all admin-only stuff."}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-07-11 12:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-11 12:53:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> > There's some rework still needed here wrt moving user-facing info
 > into its own doc, but that's work for another patch
 > 
 > I'm not sure what is user-facing about this since by default this
 > is all admin-only stuff.

It is? The docs [1] I'd been reading said availability zones were end-user facing while host aggregates were not. If these are all admin-only, then the term "end-user" is a very confusing one.

You should probably take a look at [2] once I drop the WIP tag.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/aggregates.html#availability-zones-azs
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667133'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-11 13:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-11 14:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> It is? The docs [1] I'd been reading said availability zones were end-user facing while host aggregates were not. If these are all admin-only, then the term "end-user" is a very confusing one.

AZs are end-user (non-admin tenant user) facing when you create a server, that's true. The things described in this document, which are:

1. the legacy way to force a server on a specific host/node

2. the new way to request a server goes on a specific host/node

Are admin-only by default policy. So AZs are not admin-only in general (like host aggregates) but the concepts in this particular doc are admin-only since only admins (by default) have access to the APIs that show the hypervisors and compute services.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-11 15:38:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> AZs are end-user (non-admin tenant user) facing when you create a
 > server, that's true. The things described in this document, which
 > are:
 > 
 > 1. the legacy way to force a server on a specific host/node
 > 
 > 2. the new way to request a server goes on a specific host/node
 > 
 > Are admin-only by default policy. So AZs are not admin-only in
 > general (like host aggregates) but the concepts in this particular
 > doc are admin-only since only admins (by default) have access to
 > the APIs that show the hypervisors and compute services.

Yeah, the fact that the file was named 'availability-zones.rst' but didn't actually give any information about what an availability zone was was what threw me. In any case, my comment was indeed incorrect. I've gone ahead and rebased the patch [1] that does add a whole lot of information about AZs and host aggregates that might be worth a review when you've a chance (it's probably wrong in a few places) but this is still good as-is.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667133/"}, {'account_id': 28706, 'date': '2019-07-12 02:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-07-12 04:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Update AZ admin doc to mention the new way to specify hosts

Mention the new way to specify hosts where instances are launched.
Compare with these two ways.

Also fixed a few things in the existing docs:

1. Fixed the policy rule name for forced_host.
2. Updated the "openstack availability zone list" command to use the
   --compute option.
3. Replaced the "openstack host list" example with
   "openstack compute service list --service nova-compute"
   since the os-hosts API was deprecated in 2.43.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669609/

Part of Blueprint: add-host-and-hypervisor-hostname-flag-to-create-server

Change-Id: Ic471c0621e15aa497d33ef010c7f87890508fbeb

commit_message:
stein: Ensure mysqldb driver is installed

The default MySQL dialect for Django in Ubuntu Disco or later
switch back to mysqldb rather than pymysql; ensure that required
driver is installed for stein or later.

Change-Id: Ib03353d12d38b5a5ef1bac820470636c886ec8dc
Closes-Bug: 1834614

subject: Make placement testing easier on osx
messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-17 12:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-17 21:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This looks sane to me. I'd like Stephen and/or prometheanfire to ack that you've spelled things correctly, then I'll +2."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-07-17 21:57:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Unfortunately I can't test this on osx, so not sure how helpful I'd be.

From a reqs perspective, this might be ok, I don't think we've encountered this situation before."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:39:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Assuming you don't actually need these dependencies for testing, we usually solve this by using "extras" and not installing these things by default. However, this also works.

I assume you've tested this yourself, Chris? The syntax looks fine but I also can't test it either. I'm also afraid it might break at some point in the future, though maybe by then it won't matter'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-18 09:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Assuming you don't actually need these dependencies for testing, we
 > usually solve this by using "extras" and not installing these
 > things by default. However, this also works.
 > 
 > I assume you've tested this yourself, Chris? The syntax looks fine
 > but I also can't test it either. I'm also afraid it might break at
 > some point in the future, though maybe by then it won't matter

They are used for testing in the gate, for the opportunistic db tests (for migration testing): if the drivers and database are present, then mysql and postgresql are testing for the migrations (in addition to sqlite).

I have tested this locally. It works. I borrowed the syntax from: https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/commit/ad878cea6afbb35224ca3e425151268ec9a573fc/global-requirements.txt#L219'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-18 15:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> I borrowed the syntax from: https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/commit/ad878cea6afbb35224ca3e425151268ec9a573fc/global-requirements.txt#L219

Ah, okay, precedent wfm.

Given that, and since Stephen & prometheanfire didn't come back with, "eek, this is definitely broken," and since this doesn't hurt those on other platforms, and since Chris asserts this works for him locally, I'm happy to approve.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-23 10:45:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Okay, let's do it"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 12:28:56.000000000', 'message': 'Make placement testing easier on osx

Placement can run just fine on OSX but running the tests can
be a bit cumbersome since dev libraries for ssl, postresql,
and mysql are required (directly or indirectly) by
test-requirements.txt, even though for non-gate testing we don't
usually need them, and dealing with dynamic libraries is a
frequent source of pain and discomfort on OSX.

This change says "don't import SQL drivers for mysql and postgresql
when testing on darwin".

Change-Id: Ic0ff55f00e0312251207fd079cf7b7e98d950c87
'}]
commit_message:
Make placement testing easier on osx

Placement can run just fine on OSX but running the tests can
be a bit cumbersome since dev libraries for ssl, postresql,
and mysql are required (directly or indirectly) by
test-requirements.txt, even though for non-gate testing we don't
usually need them, and dealing with dynamic libraries is a
frequent source of pain and discomfort on OSX.

This change says "don't import SQL drivers for mysql and postgresql
when testing on darwin".

Change-Id: Ic0ff55f00e0312251207fd079cf7b7e98d950c87

commit_message:
Remove Newton-era min compute checks for server create with device tags

Compute service version 14 is from Newton [1] so we can remove
the API min compute version checks for creating a server with
bdm and vif device tags. Note that the docstrings which are
removed mentioned microversion support but that was wrong - the
request schema validation is what validates the microversion used.

[1] I8367f740d6d4ebaeb81bc74c6a82a8faf5cd8308

Change-Id: I97e67fb971b7a0cc2373b558907c7354646cf5fa

oh, you're right, we need to have ceph-ansible **rc9 tag** to test the scenario with the new component.

From what I see here:

1. ceph-ansible version is rc5 [1]; in this version we don't have the playbooks for the dashboard as rc9 introduces them (dashboard_enabled: true has no effect on c-a);

2. from a pure templates perspective we can see the ceph-ansible parameters are correctly generated (as per [2], [3] and [4]), so this is good according to the whole chain we have;

3. on [5], for future runs with rc9 I will expect to find grafana+prometheus+alertmanager containers;

[5] http://logs.openstack.org/28/668028/5/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone/36995c5/logs/undercloud/var/log/extra/podman/containers/"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-07-02 16:34:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

subject: Fix v1 hybrid storage python2 python3 string type comparison in memory
messages:
[{'account_id': 30679, 'date': '2019-07-11 10:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-11 10:33:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24849, 'date': '2019-07-12 17:59:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

hi,all
any suggestios for the compatibility issue. we find that python2 and python3 is different type for res_type_info['qty_metric']:

python2: six.string_type
python3: six.text_type"}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-07-15 08:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello, thanks for your contribution! The fix looks good to me. Could you please update your commit message to something like "

Fix hybrid storage python3 string type comparison

Comparing an object against six.string_types instead of six.text_type for python3 compatibility.
"

In any case, I'd definitely not recommend to use the hybrid storage in production. If possible, I'd advise to use the v2 InfluxDB storage.'}, {'account_id': 30679, 'date': '2019-07-15 09:19:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30679, 'date': '2019-07-15 09:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30679, 'date': '2019-07-15 09:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24849, 'date': '2019-07-15 11:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

thanks for you advisement, Luka, can you briefly show the reasons why you recommend not to use hybrid in production? or some documentation describe some knowledge we can learn from.

we currently use stable/rocky branch and find v2 is also a similar gnocchi backend, it is changed in the stein and master, right?'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-07-15 11:57:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the update!

The hybrid backend will be deprecated once the v2 storage backend will be considered stable. It has not been updated for a long time.

The v2 gnocchi storage driver was a quick implementation, mostly used for testing purposes. It has now be replaced by the v2 InfluxDB storage driver,

Furthermore, using a v1 storage driver disables the v2 API, which means that you won't be able to use CloudKitty's latest features.

In case you dislike InfluxDB, a v2 elasticsearch driver is planned and should be implemented soon."}, {'account_id': 24849, 'date': '2019-07-15 14:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

cool, thanks for your explanation,'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-07-18 12:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2019-07-19 13:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Thanks for your contribution,

Much appreciated indeed !

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-07-19 14:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 24849, 'date': '2019-07-23 11:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi, Luka Peschke,  can we still preserve the gnocchi backend in v2 storage? after some discussion, it is not quite suitable to store rating data in monitoring databases like influxdb or promethues, Because they are not strong  data consistency. But the rating data is critical, which is quite different with monitoring data, right? So we think gnocchi with ceph backend is one of the best option to make stored data strong consistency.'}, {'account_id': 24849, 'date': '2019-07-23 11:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

so can we add gnocchi backend back to v2 storage? if so, we can help to do this, and maintain the codes.'}, {'account_id': 5055, 'date': '2019-07-23 11:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Yes, why not use gnocchi? we also use gnocchi as cloudkitty backend.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-07-23 11:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Guys, Gnocchi wasn't flexible enough for our needs, that's why we discontinued its support. Concerning the rating data, it can be re-processed from gnocchi in case of a data loss. However, influxDb can also be ran in an instance with a cinder volume, which avoids data loss.

I'm currently working on an elasticsearch driver for the v2 storage. this may be a good gnocchi replacement for you. 

If you really want to stick with gnocchi, you can also propose a spec for a v2 storage driver for gnocchi.

In any case, I'd be happy to discuss this with you on IRC :-) (#cloudkitty on freenode)"}]

commit_message:
Fix v1 hybrid storage python2 python3 string type comparison in memory

Comparing res_type_info['qty_metric'] against six.string_types
instead of six.text_type for python2 python3 compatibility

Change-Id: I1fc4959ff7b64210a2d47ec77dc2780b320fc355
Signed-off-by: yuanrunsen <yuanrunsen@unitedstack.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-25 08:03:41.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"

This reverts commit e8d0ee1b144f4db24367ad48bd2cb4306add6672.

This commit is reverted for two reasons:

* It is undesirable that the end user can inject proxy config into
  the magnum-conductor service via the cluster template.

* The proxy settings for the magnum-conductor service may not be
  the same as those which are required in the cluster template for
  the end user VM.

Systemd, docker and podman all include native mechanisms for setting
environment variables for proecesses, and this should be used by the
cloud operator / deployment tooling to configure the required proxy
settings for the magnum-conductor service.

In particular this patch makes it impossible for the cloud operator
to specify their own http_proxy via the environment, the user supplied
cluster template setting will always be used.

Change-Id: I33da19ad6764bedcf15f2a08381063e2471f8991

commit_message:
Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"

[stable branch policy requiring a backport rather than an 'in branch'
revert means that the following revert SHA refers to the parent patch,
not to this branch]

This reverts commit e8d0ee1b144f4db24367ad48bd2cb4306add6672.

This commit is reverted for two reasons:

* It is undesirable that the end user can inject proxy config into
  the magnum-conductor service via the cluster template.

* The proxy settings for the magnum-conductor service may not be
  the same as those which are required in the cluster template for
  the end user VM.

Systemd, docker and podman all include native mechanisms for setting
environment variables for proecesses, and this should be used by the
cloud operator / deployment tooling to configure the required proxy
settings for the magnum-conductor service.

In particular this patch makes it impossible for the cloud operator
to specify their own http_proxy via the environment, the user supplied
cluster template setting will always be used.

conflicts: magnum/drivers/heat/template_def.py

Change-Id: I33da19ad6764bedcf15f2a08381063e2471f8991
(cherry picked from commit 79699f23cddf906753b02562f6d2aebc03e3e15e)
(cherry picked from commit 1c4f8127f183724fb885662e68d1133899c3336c)

[{'created': '2019-07-22 16:36:40.000000000', 'message': "Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the

[{'created': '2019-07-17 02:06:42.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Cache active nodes

When an active node introspection is performed
where an entry already exists in ironic, but inspector
has never seen the node before, we enter a state where
we should allow introspection to occur, but that we don't
have a cache record.

As a result of no cache entry, we presently fail hard claiming
the node's port already exists. In the case of active nodes,
This will always be the case, so we need to add a cache
entry and allow the process to... somewhat continue as if
normal introspeciton is occuring.

Change-Id: Ib20b4a4e4d46ba23b8a4d87791cf30a957f1f9f9
Story: 2006233
Task: 35834

commit_message:
Active node introspection for nodes not in cache

When an active node introspection is performed
where an entry already exists in ironic, but inspector
has never seen the node before, we enter a state where
we should allow introspection to occur, but that we don't
have a cache record.

As a result of no cache entry, we presently fail hard claiming
the node's port already exists. In the case of active nodes,
This will always be the case, so we need to add a cache
entry and allow the process to... somewhat continue as if
normal introspeciton is occuring.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib20b4a4e4d46ba23b8a4d87791cf30a957f1f9f9
Story: 2006233
Task: 35834

[{'created': '2019-07-18 13:34:09.000000000', 'message': 'Only run cellv2 host discovery on default cell

While it would be not an issue to run the host discovery on sub
sequent deploy runs, on the initial cell deplouy the discovery
fails because the cell is not yet defined in nova as this is
a manual post task after the initial cell deployment [1]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-docs/latest/install/advanced_deployment/deploy_cellv2.html#create-the-cell-and-discover-compute-nodes

Change-Id: I42451a8b4dcc690319439415570ce36e5c5333c3
Closes-bug: #1836915
'}]
commit_message:
Only run cellv2 host discovery on default cell

While it would be not an issue to run the host discovery on sub
sequent deploy runs, on the initial cell deplouy the discovery
fails because the cell is not yet defined in nova as this is
a manual post task after the initial cell deployment [1]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-docs/latest/install/advanced_deployment/deploy_cellv2.html#create-the-cell-and-discover-compute-nodes

Change-Id: I42451a8b4dcc690319439415570ce36e5c5333c3
Closes-bug: #1836915

[{'created': '2019-06-17 14:14:33.000000000', 'message': 'Update amphora-agent to report UDP listener health

Currently the amphora-agent is not reporting UDP listener health
when the UDP listener does not have a pool and members.
This patch changes that behavior to report the listener as healthy
if the keepalived process is started and running in the amphora.

This patch also introduces message versioning for the health
heartbeat messages.

It also corrects a few assertEqual tests that had the reference and
actual values backwards.

Change-Id: Ifc28b4991852e59c0d27b4ab3d1afc4e9965e88b
Story: 2003592
Task: 24911
(cherry picked from commit 2170cc6c459b7ae8461a09a0b6fd754ecef9654e)
'}]
commit_message:
Update amphora-agent to report UDP listener health

Currently the amphora-agent is not reporting UDP listener health
when the UDP listener does not have a pool and members.
This patch changes that behavior to report the listener as healthy
if the keepalived process is started and running in the amphora.

This patch also introduces message versioning for the health
heartbeat messages.

It also corrects a few assertEqual tests that had the reference and
actual values backwards.

Change-Id: Ifc28b4991852e59c0d27b4ab3d1afc4e9965e88b
Story: 2003592
Task: 24911
(cherry picked from commit 2170cc6c459b7ae8461a09a0b6fd754ecef9654e)

commit_message:
Use python3 for doc build

Without this patch, the doc build for the keystone package fails with a
Sphinx incompatibility:

  AttributeError: 'Sphinx' object has no attribute 'add_css_file'

Sphinx 2.x has dropped support for python2, so start using the python3
versions of these packages which should get them all in sync.

Change-Id: Ie821e88003b554ca97bdbc605e71633097a3c3b0

[{'created': '2019-07-19 08:48:32.000000000', 'message': 'tools: fix validation of some py3 specs

Assuming the reason run_renderspec skipped py3 was to avoid
speccleaner complaining about single line py2 and py3 BuildRequires,
this patch changes the way to achieve that while supporting other
different ways to write py3 specs that would otherwise would not be
recognized as py3 only and end up with blank BuildRequires and the
like, specifically:

* singlespecs with py3 flavor only (new networking-l2gw spec)
* py3 specs for which the package name is rendered instead of forced
  (networking-generic-switch)

Change-Id: I62fad6d140338ee9af7eca144edb4ae6e96f6007
'}]
commit_message:
tools: fix validation of some py3 specs

Assuming the reason run_renderspec skipped py3 was to avoid
speccleaner complaining about single line py2 and py3 BuildRequires,
this patch changes the way to achieve that while supporting other
different ways to write py3 specs that would otherwise would not be
recognized as py3 only and end up with blank BuildRequires and the
like, specifically:

* singlespecs with py3 flavor only (new networking-l2gw spec)
* py3 specs for which the package name is rendered instead of forced
  (networking-generic-switch)

Change-Id: I62fad6d140338ee9af7eca144edb4ae6e96f6007

commit_message:
Ensure that admin endpoint is used to configure octavia quota

The default is the public endpoint which will fail with an SSL error
for AIO or other non-trusted certificates.

Change-Id: I62e4f9d454b75e0fc87a7df2cf70d119e627ea9d
Closes-Bug: 1831160
Closes-Bug: 1828599
(cherry picked from 2b39df7d8de3856185ebef0b24382cd0d8b18cca and
modified for rocky branch)

@Spyros, we found the calico can't work after I2935d34ace08800c805028f1673bc515f2f577e6 can this patch fix that? Otherwise, we may need a patch to enable --allow-priv when using calico"}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-07-16 08:26:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-07-22 11:46:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> @Spyros, we found the calico can't work after I2935d34ace08800c805028f1673bc515f2f577e6
 > can this patch fix that? Otherwise, we may need a patch to enable
 > --allow-priv when using calico

Which version doesn't work? Only the latest builds are affected. When running any pod (not only calico, ANY pod), the cni pods run as privileged.

We need this change so that the latest builds have this option available.

I don't know why calico doesn't work. If it doesn't start because of kubelet not allowing privileged pods, yes this patch will result into builds that will fix this."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-07-23 02:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-07-23 02:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-07-23 07:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
ci: Fix ADD_ALLOW_PRIV build-arg

In [0] we added a build-arg for the deprecaeted
--allow-priv option. This arg needs to be defined
after the FROM line in the dockerfile.

Note, other systems like podman can use the
arg even before the FROM statement. Docker needs
it after.

[0] I2935d34ace08800c805028f1673bc515f2f577e6

story: 2005124

Change-Id: I34af2451e92962b835ac0f1a1e49dfcbfd477830
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-13 20:36:07.000000000', 'message': 'Do not add container /etc/hosts entry for 127.0.1.1

This patch removes a task which adds an entry to /etc/hosts for
the container hostname / 127.0.1.1.

Some services, such as rabbitmq, require that the ip address they
are configured to listen on resolves to a hostname with the same
ip. Before this patch there were two /etc/hosts entries for the
hostname of each container, 127.0.1.1 and the container mgmt
network address.

This patch ensures that the /etc/hosts file is unambiguous and
always resolves the container hostname to the mgmt network ip
address.

Change-Id: I5c9bf4cd0a3a416447f6f1797df4657402a64382
'}, {'created': '2019-07-14 08:22:16.000000000', 'message': 'Do not add /etc/hosts entry for 127.0.1.1

This patch removes a task which adds an entry to /etc/hosts for
the hostname / 127.0.1.1.

Some services, such as rabbitmq, require that the ip address they
are configured to listen on resolves to a hostname with the same
ip. Before this patch there were two /etc/hosts entries for the
hostname of each host, 127.0.1.1 and the mgmt network address.

This patch ensures that the /etc/hosts file is unambiguous and
always resolves the hostname to the mgmt network ip address.

Change-Id: I5c9bf4cd0a3a416447f6f1797df4657402a64382
'}]
commit_message:
Do not add /etc/hosts entry for 127.0.1.1

This patch removes a task which adds an entry to /etc/hosts for
the hostname / 127.0.1.1.

Some services, such as rabbitmq, require that the ip address they
are configured to listen on resolves to a hostname with the same
ip. Before this patch there were two /etc/hosts entries for the
hostname of each host, 127.0.1.1 and the mgmt network address.

This patch ensures that the /etc/hosts file is unambiguous and
always resolves the hostname to the mgmt network ip address.

Change-Id: I5c9bf4cd0a3a416447f6f1797df4657402a64382

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: Id935a52232bc1ed22b457fc1227dcc4e8ec2babf

commit_message:
Remove nginx default conf

This patch make sure Default.conf from nginx
is remove as it causes socket conflict when
we deploy it on metal. Also, we remove the
task created by kevin for Q -> S deployments
as it is not required to S -> T upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic2e3bc66161217b2884001018a706dbe2187c498

commit_message:
Remove transitional single argument del_network support

In If1257fad47d05016dc59a8cfc60f5d2d22be420c, the del_network device
method was switched from accepting a single segmentation ID argument to
also accepting the network ID. Transitional support was added for out of
tree device drivers which have not switched. This has now been removed.

Change-Id: I19d67931695d795968c0d9e341a6ef959bfc4818
Story: 2006221
Task: 35819

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: I9f617159eddc8af532403e47c325048d92cc9ade

commit_message:
Fix copying apt keys from host to containers

Without the trailing slash the keys had an extra level of directories
as follows: /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/trusted.gpg.d/<keys>

Change-Id: Ibe4112ef947513439643025ddf0fd543b28aba70
(cherry picked from commit 9fd34ada152889c06c744ea5b4928c3554c9b4c5)

commit_message:
Add --force for loadbalancer delete

Currently it is possible to have stale loadbalancers
in PENDING status in the cloud.
The only way for cloud administrator to clear these loadbalancers
- manually change its state in db for ERROR and then delete them.

Proposed change add --force option for delete command, which
will allow user with admin rights delete loadbalancer in
PENDING state if was not updated for a rather long time.
(variable load_balancer_expiry_age is used).

Change-Id: Ic9e1215700cbbb074b25db4d5aaf61eeac2c6789
Story: 2005459
Task: 30528

subject: Add force for loadbalancer delete
messages:
[{'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-16 09:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-04-16 09:49:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

The issue reported on the story has been a pain-point for many operators, and it's been discussed quite often. What leads to this problem is the lack of pre-maintenance actions by operators. Operators should gracefully shutdown services. We want to document that, but we shamefully we haven't yet. It would be very much appreciated if someone could volunteer to prepare such a document.

Please note that this patch wouldn't qualify as backport candidate because it makes changes to the API.

Release note is missing."}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-16 10:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Carlos Goncalves
Thanks for quick review!

I do not expect this change to be backported in upstream but this will make life of operators a bit easier in future releases.

Documentation is a good point but operator should be able to resolve known issues at least without going in db.
Will add release note and fix comments.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-04-16 15:36:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I acknowledge the problem with non-graceful shutdowns, however I think there is a better way to address this.
Beyond the two provided comments, this patch does not make sure that one of the controllers is not actively working on (retrying) an activity on this load balancer.  It should check with the cw, hm, and hk processes to make sure they are not actively working on this load balancer (thus, the PENDING_ lock).'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-17 06:33:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Michael Johnson
Thanks for review!
This is not solution for graceful shutdown - solution is to use taskflow persistence and I pushed PoC some time ago https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647406/
Current change is a workaround to resolve the results of it.
For me, it make sense that operator should be able to delete loadbalancer if it hangs in PENDING for long time -  load_balancer_expiry_age is like an hour. If it can be not enough we can introduce another value or make it load_balancer_expiry_age * 2,3..'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-17 07:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-17 07:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-17 11:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-04-30 12:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

As I understand not having something like force delete was decided long ago.
Anyway, I feel I need to write down some points, why it is good to have it.
Admin user should have experience how things work in OpenStack, but we cannot expect that admin had experience in db. This means he can accidentally update wrong row, update all rows in table, drop rows or table. So, interactions with db should be strictly limited. Also, cloud operator may not have access for db at all (for security reasons). Therefore, if the situation is well-known there should be a way to handle it with cli.'}, {'account_id': 23871, 'date': '2019-05-08 12:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-07-23 08:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon in favor of taskflow jobboard work https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005072'}]

Proposed change add --force option for delete command, which

commit_message:
Add force for loadbalancer delete

Currently it is possible to have stale loadbalancers
in PENDING status in the cloud.
The only way for cloud administrator to clear these loadbalancers
- manually change its state in db for ERROR and then delete them.

Proposed change add --force option for delete command, which
will allow user with admin rights delete loadbalancer in
PENDING state if was not updated for a rather long time.
(variable loadbalancer_pending_timeout intoduced).

Story: 2005459
Task: 30527

Change-Id: I5c86a343e57ca6f09c859a04b533c2114dcb9ee8

[{'created': '2019-07-13 20:32:48.000000000', 'message': 'Do not add contaienr /etc/hosts entry for 127.0.1.1

This patch removes a task which adds an entry to /etc/hosts for
the container hostname / 127.0.1.1.

Some services, such as rabbitmq, require that the ip address they
are configured to listen on resolves to a hostname with the same
ip. Before this patch there were two /etc/hosts entries for the
hostname of each container, 127.0.1.1 and the container mgmt
network address.

This patch ensures that the /etc/hosts file is unambiguous and
always resolves the container hostname to the mgmt network ip
address.

Change-Id: I900bda8031d7b0798f73adf8985e64d4535be769
'}, {'created': '2019-07-13 20:33:16.000000000', 'message': 'Do not add container /etc/hosts entry for 127.0.1.1

are configured to listen on resolves to a hostname with the same

always resolves the container hostname to the mgmt network ip

Change-Id: I900bda8031d7b0798f73adf8985e64d4535be769
'}]
commit_message:
Do not add container /etc/hosts entry for 127.0.1.1

This patch removes a task which adds an entry to /etc/hosts for
the container hostname / 127.0.1.1.

Some services, such as rabbitmq, require that the ip address they
are configured to listen on resolves to a hostname with the same
ip. Before this patch there were two /etc/hosts entries for the
hostname of each container, 127.0.1.1 and the container mgmt
network address.

This patch ensures that the /etc/hosts file is unambiguous and
always resolves the container hostname to the mgmt network ip
address.

Change-Id: I900bda8031d7b0798f73adf8985e64d4535be769

The job has been failing for a long time. Java implementation of
InfluxDB persister is not maintained anymore.

commit_message:
py3: Support py3 functional test

OpenStack Swift is close to release py3 support so we could run
py3 fuctional test as non-voting gate. we will fix issues found
at the gate by the end of year (py2 retirement)

Change-Id: I778e6eaee7632d1ee9eb5a48bd1a3ae1d6c4e25a

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: I28660f7f7cfce3893071bfb7e29892d34f633856

commit_message:
horizon-plugins: Avoid fileconflict over __init__.*

The various horizon-plugins all install a __init__.* into the same
location, which causes a fileconflict. as we don't need those (they're
provided and owned by openstack-dashboard/horizon itself) we can just
skip them on install.

Change-Id: Ia14b25d9060fe522154a8b98c05383699bca835c
(cherry picked from commit 9bab67927c2f7f132b7a640e7403b44f1533eed0)

commit_message:
neutron-fwaas-dashboard: fix file conflict

The wildcard for including files from openstack_dashboard/enabled/
captured init.py as well which is already included with
Horizon itself (it's empty in both cases), thus leading to a
file conflict. This commit fixes the issue by including only
_7010_project_firewalls_panel.py*.

Change-Id: I1988420d042d921fa915ec772a3975457fa1f88f

commit_message:
fix host-specific overrides incorrectly overwriting previous values

root_conf area is used for host-specific configuration and overwritten in
each round of loop. It causes that all hosts will share same properties.
This makes use each host's own area in the loop.

Task: 34282
Story: 2005936

Change-Id: I0afb0b32ab80456aa3439b4221f2a95ca05ddf24

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: I30a51394d396cc89f647b4170d6a2e6b0b993dcb

commit_message:
Add process name to log in external_process disable method

It can be useful to have information about what process
exactly was not started or was stale for resource.
For example, in case of DHCP agent it can be dnsmasq or haproxy
process for same network and information about that in logs
will be useful.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I480ae33cf77849927fef456b3504aead34911208

commit_message:
Yield control to other greenthreads while processing trusted ports

process_trusted_ports() appeared to be greenthread unfriendly, so
if there are many trusted ports on a node, openvswitch agent may
"hang" for a significant time.
This patch adds explicit yield.

Change-Id: I7c00812f877e2fc966bbac3060e1187ce1b809ca
Closes-Bug: #1836023
(cherry picked from commit da539da3780188f01e18ef106dde9ca180324c2a)

commit_message:
Add cloud-init-datasources DIB element

The cloud-init-datasources DIB element configures cloud-init to only use
an explicit list of data sources. Until the switch from ubuntu element
to ubuntu-minimal, cloud-init was being configured to only use
ConfigDrive datasource because the ubuntu element had
cloud-init-datasources as element dependency. The ubuntu-minimal and
other OS elements (e.g. RHEL-based) do not have it, so the export
DIB_CLOUD_INIT_DATASOURCES was not being used.

Change-Id: I74ecc826596c5f739a49defe6588bcc741b03594

commit_message:
Widen exception catch for point parse failure

This change supports catching more parse errors which can jam
the persistor, such as:
`partial write: unable to parse 'string_with_invalid_char.%'`.

Change-Id: Ia12d04708a88308e88fcbd488d72f4313ba42a36
Story: 2005430
Task: 30468
(cherry picked from commit f43d019a6726552f80d16a6e98cb947c063b4e74)

commit_message:
Add project_id to all of the provider objects

This patch adds a project_id field to all of the provider driver data
model objects.

This is useful for drivers to track/associate objects on the backend.

Change-Id: I8f509677da463bc5d0a7649f2f609045cf9b2dd7

subject: Revert "tox: Use basepython of python3.5"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-05 14:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-05 14:27:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This means your environment is more important than mine. I don't think that's a fair assumption or a fair thing to do. nova is supposed to support multiple distros and the reason I gave in the commit (about the basepython version in Rocky is valid). I can't block this but I'd much rather we though about another way to do this first"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-05 14:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-05 14:30:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This means your environment is more important than mine.

There is no 3.7 support in rocky for nova, so yes I think that's fair when rocky supports 3.6 and that's what I'm running with on this branch."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-05 14:32:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > This means your environment is more important than mine.
 > 
 > There is no 3.7 support in rocky for nova, so yes I think that's
 > fair when rocky supports 3.6 and that's what I'm running with on
 > this branch.

No, without that change we're running whatever version of Python 3 your system gives you, not one of the version we say we support (3.5 or 3.6, afaict). We're basically relying on the behavior of the distro which is locking us to Ubuntu. That's broken behavior, IMO."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-05 14:36:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

This can be resolved by using a distro that provides multiple Python versions, like Fedora, or using the distro that the Rocky gate targeted, which was Ubuntu 16.04 (Xenial?). I realize that this is additional work for you, Matt, but this is technically correct and somebody's having to do some work here.

If you really want to stick with Bionic, there's the deadsnakes apt repo [1] which provides multiple Python versions, though it doesn't do anything for the other binary dependencies on the system that changed between the two releases.

[1] https://launchpad.net/~deadsnakes/+archive/ubuntu/ppa"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-07-05 16:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/669362/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 07m 21s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-22 22:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-05 14:25:43.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "tox: Use basepython of python3.5"

This reverts commit 0d2d4d688928d83dde8343dac609fbc283a6a240.

This change broke fast8/pep8 for environments that don't have
python 3.5, like ubuntu bionic. While the py37 reason in the
change is valid, there is no py37 target in rocky but there is
a py36 target (though py27 and py35 are what we actually test
against in the gate). As such, it seems most reasonable to
revert this to make py36 work as before and for those with
only py37 systems they will have to use a different
environment for working on stable/rocky changes.

Change-Id: I17cb1e58efdff5942dc8392c68514cf581506939
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "tox: Use basepython of python3.5"

This reverts commit 0d2d4d688928d83dde8343dac609fbc283a6a240.

This change broke fast8/pep8 for environments that don't have
python 3.5, like ubuntu bionic. While the py37 reason in the
change is valid, there is no py37 target in rocky but there is
a py36 target (though py27 and py35 are what we actually test
against in the gate). As such, it seems most reasonable to
revert this to make py36 work as before and for those with
only py37 systems they will have to use a different
environment for working on stable/rocky changes.

Change-Id: I17cb1e58efdff5942dc8392c68514cf581506939

Add 'resource_request' to neutronv2/constants

This patch replaces of the string usage with referring to the new
constant in neutronv2/constants.py

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > hmm. I haven't got the brain power today to give this a proper
 > review. There are a couple of comments within.
 > 
 > Another thing I noticed is that a lot of the new private methods in
 > nova.cmd.manage looked like things anybody wanting to manipulate
 > allocations might like to do. I know we have a "merge allocations"
 > in at least one other location.

Do you refer to nova.scheduler.client.report._move_operation_alloc_request() ? Unfortunately that code has a special case noted in the code:

    # Remove any allocations against resource providers that are
    # already allocated against on the source host (like shared storage
    # providers)

So I'm not sure how can make a common generic function out of it.

 > 
 > good work teasing all this out, it's making me blink'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-03-28 13:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-03-28 13:35:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Functionality-wise I'm mostly just concerned about weird side effect issues of a resource_request with no resources or required traits, as mentioned in _get_port_allocation, which shouldn't happen for minimum QoS bandwidth ports but doesn't seem to be codified in the neutron API - so I worry about future weirdness (or misconfigured neutron). It might be easier to just explicitly filter those things out (or explicitly fail). Still haven't gone into the tests yet. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 17:54:27.000000000', 'message': "nova-manage: heal port allocations

<Brew a cup of coffee or tea before you read the patch, it is complex>

Before I97f06d0ec34cbd75c182caaa686b8de5c777a576 it was possible to
create servers with neutron ports had resource_request (e.g. a port with
QoS minimum bandwidth policy rule) without allocated the requested
resources in placement. So there could be servers which allocation needs
to be healed in placement.

This patch extends the nova-manage heal_allocation CLI to create the
missing port allocations in placement and update the port in neutron
with the resource provider uuid that is used for the allocation.

There are known limiations of this patch. It does not try to reimplement
Placement's allocation candidate functionality. Therefore it cannot
handle the situation when there is more than one RP on in the compute
tree which provides the required traits for a port. In this situation
deciding which RP to use would require the in_tree allocation candidate
support from placement which is not available yet and 2) information
about which PCI PF an SRIOV port is allocated from its VF and which RP
represents that PCI device in placement. This information is only
available on the compute hosts.

For the unsupported cases the command will fail gracefully. As soon as
migration support for such server are implemented the admin can heal the
allocation of such servers by migrating them.

TODO:
* more test
* documentation
* refactor a lot

Change-Id: I4b2b1688822eb2f0174df0c8c6c16d554781af85

Before I97f06d0ec34cbd75c182caaa686b8de5c777a576 it was possible to
create servers with neutron ports had resource_request (e.g. a port with
QoS minimum bandwidth policy rule) without allocated the requested
resources in placement. So there could be servers which allocation needs
to be healed in placement.

This patch extends the nova-manage heal_allocation CLI to create the
missing port allocations in placement and update the port in neutron
with the resource provider uuid that is used for the allocation.

There are known limiations of this patch. It does not try to reimplement
Placement's allocation candidate functionality. Therefore it cannot
handle the situation when there is more than one RP on in the compute
tree which provides the required traits for a port. In this situation
deciding which RP to use would require the in_tree allocation candidate
support from placement which is not available yet and 2) information
about which PCI PF an SRIOV port is allocated from its VF and which RP
represents that PCI device in placement. This information is only
available on the compute hosts.

For the unsupported cases the command will fail gracefully. As soon as
migration support for such server are implemented the admin can heal the
allocation of such servers by migrating them.

TODO:
* more test
* documentation
* refactor a lot

Change-Id: I4b2b1688822eb2f0174df0c8c6c16d554781af85

"}, {'created': '2019-03-28 17:19:01.000000000', 'message': "nova-manage: heal port allocations

<Brew a cup of coffee or tea before you read the patch, it is complex>

Before I97f06d0ec34cbd75c182caaa686b8de5c777a576 it was possible to
create servers with neutron ports had resource_request (e.g. a port with
QoS minimum bandwidth policy rule) without allocated the requested
resources in placement. So there could be servers which allocation needs
to be healed in placement.

This patch extends the nova-manage heal_allocation CLI to create the
missing port allocations in placement and update the port in neutron
with the resource provider uuid that is used for the allocation.

There are known limiations of this patch. It does not try to reimplement
Placement's allocation candidate functionality. Therefore it cannot
handle the situation when there is more than one RP on in the compute
tree which provides the required traits for a port. In this situation
deciding which RP to use would require the in_tree allocation candidate
support from placement which is not available yet and 2) information
about which PCI PF an SRIOV port is allocated from its VF and which RP
represents that PCI device in placement. This information is only
available on the compute hosts.

For the unsupported cases the command will fail gracefully. As soon as
migration support for such server are implemented the admin can heal the
allocation of such servers by migrating them.

There is one edge case that needs manual steps to recover from. If the
allocation in placement is healed successfully for an instance but the
binding:profile.allocation key of any of the ports of the instance
cannot be updated in neutron then the script does not try to rollback
the placement allocation. The script will print out a detailed error
message and a list of OpenStack CLI commands asking the admin to run
them before continue healing allocatons. If the healing is run again
without this step the placement allocations for the ports of this
instance are doubled.

TODO:
* more test
* documentation
* refactor

Closes-Bug: #1819923
Change-Id: I4b2b1688822eb2f0174df0c8c6c16d554781af85

the placement allocation. The script will print out a detailed error
message and a list of OpenStack CLI commands asking the admin to run
them before continue healing allocatons. If the healing is run again
without this step the placement allocations for the ports of this
instance are doubled.

Closes-Bug: #1819923
Change-Id: I4b2b1688822eb2f0174df0c8c6c16d554781af85
"}, {'created': '2019-05-28 08:13:54.000000000', 'message': "nova-manage: heal port allocations

Before I97f06d0ec34cbd75c182caaa686b8de5c777a576 it was possible to
create servers with neutron ports had resource_request (e.g. a port with
QoS minimum bandwidth policy rule) without allocated the requested
resources in placement. So there could be servers which allocation needs
to be healed in placement.

This patch extends the nova-manage heal_allocation CLI to create the
missing port allocations in placement and update the port in neutron
with the resource provider uuid that is used for the allocation.

There are known limiations of this patch. It does not try to reimplement
Placement's allocation candidate functionality. Therefore it cannot
handle the situation when there is more than one RP on in the compute
tree which provides the required traits for a port. In this situation
deciding which RP to use would require the in_tree allocation candidate
support from placement which is not available yet and 2) information
about which PCI PF an SRIOV port is allocated from its VF and which RP
represents that PCI device in placement. This information is only
available on the compute hosts.

For the unsupported cases the command will fail gracefully. As soon as
migration support for such server are implemented the admin can heal the
allocation of such servers by migrating them.

There is one edge case that needs manual steps to recover from. If the
allocation in placement is healed successfully for an instance but the
binding:profile.allocation key of any of the ports of the instance
cannot be updated in neutron then the script does not try to rollback
the placement allocation. The script will print out a detailed error
message and a list of OpenStack CLI commands asking the admin to run
them before continue healing allocatons. If the healing is run again
without this step the placement allocations for the ports of this
instance are doubled.

Closes-Bug: #1819923
Change-Id: I4b2b1688822eb2f0174df0c8c6c16d554781af85

commit_message:
nova-manage: heal port allocations

Before I97f06d0ec34cbd75c182caaa686b8de5c777a576 it was possible to
create servers with neutron ports which had resource_request (e.g. a
port with QoS minimum bandwidth policy rule) without allocating the
requested resources in placement. So there could be servers for which
the allocation needs to be healed in placement.

This patch extends the nova-manage heal_allocation CLI to create the
missing port allocations in placement and update the port in neutron
with the resource provider uuid that is used for the allocation.

There are known limiations of this patch. It does not try to reimplement
Placement's allocation candidate functionality. Therefore it cannot
handle the situation when there is more than one RP in the compute
tree which provides the required traits for a port. In this situation
deciding which RP to use would require the in_tree allocation candidate
support from placement which is not available yet and 2) information
about which PCI PF an SRIOV port is allocated from its VF and which RP
represents that PCI device in placement. This information is only
available on the compute hosts.

For the unsupported cases the command will fail gracefully. As soon as
migration support for such servers are implemented in the blueprint
support-move-ops-with-qos-ports the admin can heal the allocation of
such servers by migrating them.

During healing both placement and neutron need to be updated. If any of
those updates fail the code tries to roll back the previous updates for
the instance to make sure that the healing can be re-run later without
issue. However if the rollback fails then the script will terminate with
an error message pointing to documentation that describes how to
recover from such a partially healed situation manually.

Closes-Bug: #1819923
Change-Id: I4b2b1688822eb2f0174df0c8c6c16d554781af85
